author: mikeTWC1984
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Not sure if there is common way to set configuration for powershell, I guess everybody reinvent this wheel. $Profile (hard to manage programatically), env variable (too simple ), probably random json/xml. C# apps usually use appsetings.json (app.config), what if we do the same for powershell? For example, let user create appsettings.json file in the profile directory, and PS would generate some automatic variable (say $Configuration). In addition/instead this could be implemented on the module level.

# Proposed technical implementation details 
I guess it's pretty much implemented in Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration, just need to add reference and put it all together.

```csharp
    var config = new ConfigurationBuilder()
        .AddJsonFile("path/to/appsettings.json", optional: true, reloadOnChange: true)
        .Build();

    Console.WriteLine(config["MailConfig:smtp"]);
```
